elements.content: A novel three-dimensional coordination polymer [Cd2(btec)(btb)3](H2O)10 (1) (btb = 1,4-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)butane; btec = 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylate) containing an “opened-cube” with an outer edge discrete water decamer and a thick two-dimensional network [Cd2(phth)2(btb)(H2O)3](H2O)4.5 (2) (phth = 1,2-benzenedicarboxylate) containing an undulated water chain have been synthesized and characterized by single crystal X-ray diffraction analysis.
elements.clean_text: A novel three-dimensional coordination polymer [Cd2(btec)(btb)3](H2O)10 (1) (btb = 1,4-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)butane; btec = 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylate) containing an "opened-cube" with an outer edge discrete water decamer and a thick two-dimensional network [Cd2(phth)2(btb)(H2O)3](H2O)4.5 (2) (phth = 1,2-benzenedicarboxylate) containing an undulated water chain have been synthesized and characterized by single crystal X-ray diffraction analysis.

elements.content: A novel three-dimensional coordination polymer [Cd2(btec)(btb)3](H2O)10 (1) (btb = 1,4-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)butane; btec = 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylate) containing an “opened-cube” with an outer edge discrete water decamer and a thick two-dimensional network [Cd2(phth)2(btb)(H2O)3](H2O)4.5 (2) (phth = 1,2-benzenedicarboxylate) containing an undulated water chain have been synthesized and characterized.
elements.clean_text: A novel three-dimensional coordination polymer [Cd2(btec)(btb)3](H2O)10 (1) (btb = 1,4-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)butane; btec = 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylate) containing an "opened-cube" with an outer edge discrete water decamer and a thick two-dimensional network [Cd2(phth)2(btb)(H2O)3](H2O)4.5 (2) (phth = 1,2-benzenedicarboxylate) containing an undulated water chain have been synthesized and characterized.

elements.content: Water is the most abundant and cheapest solvent available for chemical processes and is essential for life processes. Water has been intensively investigated experimentally and theoretically because of its fundamental importance in biological and chemical processes. Science ranked the study of water among the top 10 breakthroughs in 2004. A variety of water clusters including tetramer, hexamer, octamer, decamer, one-dimensional (1D) and two-dimensional (2D) water morphologies found in crystalline hosts have been structurally characterized. Their structural information holds considerable promise for achieving a more accurate description of the properties of bulk water at the molecular level. The (H2O)10 cluster is of particular interest because this is the smallest unit of naturally occurring cubic ice and so-called “molecular ice”.
elements.clean_text: Water is the most abundant and cheapest solvent available for chemical processes and is essential for life processes. Water has been intensively investigated experimentally and theoretically because of its fundamental importance in biological and chemical processes. Science ranked the study of water among the top 10 breakthroughs in 2004. A variety of water clusters including tetramer, hexamer, octamer, decamer, one-dimensional (1D) and two-dimensional (2D) water morphologies found in crystalline hosts have been structurally characterized. Their structural information holds considerable promise for achieving a more accurate description of the properties of bulk water at the molecular level. The (H2O)10 cluster is of particular interest because this is the smallest unit of naturally occurring cubic ice and so-called "molecular ice".

elements.content: Organic aromatic polycarboxylate ligands, such as 1,2-benzenedicarboxylate (phth), 1,3-benzenedicarboxylate, 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate, 1,3,5-benzenetriazolate, and 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylate (btec), are good building blocks for the construction of coordination polymers and multidimensional supramolecular networks with the hydrophilic gap. Our synthetic approach starts by focusing on the construction of new topological frameworks using flexible ligands such as 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)ethane and 1,4-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene. In the present work, we chose a more flexible long chain ligand 1,4-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)butane (btb), which when combined with polycarboxylate ligands, can construct novel topologies with a hydrophilic gap. Fortunately, we synthesized a novel three-dimensional (3D) coordination polymer [Cd2(btec)(btb)3](H2O)10 (1) containing a discrete water decamer and a thick 2D network [Cd2(phth)2(btb)(H2O)3](H2O)4.5 (2) containing an undulated water chain.
elements.clean_text: Organic aromatic polycarboxylate ligands, such as 1,2-benzenedicarboxylate (phth), 1,3-benzenedicarboxylate, 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate, 1,3,5-benzenetriazolate, and 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylate (btec), are good building blocks for the construction of coordination polymers and multidimensional supramolecular networks with the hydrophilic gap. Our synthetic approach starts by focusing on the construction of new topological frameworks using flexible ligands such as 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)ethane and 1,4-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene. In the present work, we chose a more flexible long chain ligand 1,4-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)butane (btb), which when combined with polycarboxylate ligands, can construct novel topologies with a hydrophilic gap. Fortunately, we synthesized a novel three-dimensional (3D) coordination polymer [Cd2(btec)(btb)3](H2O)10 (1) containing a discrete water decamer and a thick 2D network [Cd2(phth)2(btb)(H2O)3](H2O)4.5 (2) containing an undulated water chain.

elements.content: 1 and 2 were synthesized by the slow diffusion method in CH3OH/H2O medium. The X-ray diffraction analysis reveals that 1 possesses a novel 3D architecture in which there are discrete (H2O)10 clusters. Each Cd(II) center is coordinated by three triazole nitrogen atoms from three different btb molecules and three oxygen atoms of two COO groups from two btec molecules, in a distorted octahedral geometry (). The btec ligand here shows two coordination modes: monodentate and bidentate chelating modes. Each btec ligand connects four Cd(II) atoms through its four COO groups, resulting a 2D [Cd2(btec)] n network (Figure and ). Each Cd(II) atoms links three Cd(II) atoms through three btb ligands. The btb ligands further link the 2D [Cd2(btec)] n network forming a novel 3D network (Figure ) with relatively large voids which are occupied by the decamer water clusters. The btb ligands exhibit the completely anti (antianti-anti) and gauche-antigauche conformations with Cd···Cd separations of 14.7188(14) and 13.2713(11) Å, respectively.
elements.clean_text: 1 and 2 were synthesized by the slow diffusion method in CH3OH/H2O medium. The X-ray diffraction analysis reveals that 1 possesses a novel 3D architecture in which there are discrete (H2O)10 clusters. Each Cd(II) center is coordinated by three triazole nitrogen atoms from three different btb molecules and three oxygen atoms of two COO groups from two btec molecules, in a distorted octahedral geometry (). The btec ligand here shows two coordination modes: monodentate and bidentate chelating modes. Each btec ligand connects four Cd(II) atoms through its four COO groups, resulting a 2D [Cd2(btec)] n  network (Figure  and ). Each Cd(II) atoms links three Cd(II) atoms through three btb ligands. The btb ligands further link the 2D [Cd2(btec)] n  network forming a novel 3D network (Figure ) with relatively large voids which are occupied by the decamer water clusters. The btb ligands exhibit the completely anti (antianti-anti) and gauche-antigauche conformations with Cd⋅⋅⋅Cd separations of 14.7188(14) and 13.2713(11) Å, respectively.

elements.content: Schematic view of a 2D network (top) and 3D network (bottom) of 1. Only the carboxylate carbon atoms of btec and Cd(II) atoms are shown. The representation of bth is simplified as a long blue line.
elements.clean_text: 1  Schematic view of a 2D network (top) and 3D network (bottom) of 1. Only the carboxylate carbon atoms of btec and Cd(II) atoms are shown. The representation of bth is simplified as a long blue line.

elements.content: Figure shows the arrangement of the (H2O)10 cluster. The cluster can be considered as derived from a cubic arrangement of eight water molecules with two outer edges. There are five independent water molecules. The hydrogen atoms of water molecules are located from the difference Fourier maps. However, only one appropriate hydrogen atom of O(8) is located, and no appropriate hydrogen atom of O(9) is obtained. For the five independent water molecules, four water molecules (O(5), O(6), O(8), O(9)) form a square. The O···O distances in the square are in the range of 2.751(7)−2.944(6) Å, similar to the reported cyclic water tetramer (the average O···O distance 2.834 Å) and the “opened-cube” water octamer (2.76−2.91 Å). The outer water molecule (O(7)) bridges the square water molecules and the COO group of the btec molecule via O−H···O hydrogen bonding interactions (O(7)···O(8) 2.714(6) Å; O(7)···O(1F) 2.838(4) Å). Two symmetry-related square water molecules are linked by two hydrogen bonding interactions O(5)···O(8G) and O(5G···O(9) (O···O distance 2.965(7) Å) and form the octamer water molecules. However, the oxygen atoms distances O(6)···O(9G) and O(9)···O(6G) along the opened edges are relatively long 3.454(6) Å, but shorter than 3.92 Å estimated in the “opened-cube” water octamer. The overall structure of the decamer water cluster can be described as an “opened-cube” with two outer edges. Such a structure of decamer water cluster, has not been experimentally observed so far, to the best of our knowledge. The reported structures of decamers are an adamantanoid “ice-like” cage, endohedral clusterization “molecule ice”, a cyclic decamer with boat−chair−boat conformation, a discrete 2D sheetlike fragement, nonplanar eight-membered ring and two water molecules, infinite chains, two parallel cyclic pentamers with staggered conformation, decameric water ring, and a decameric water cluster containing a quasi-planar six-membered ring.
elements.clean_text: Figure  shows the arrangement of the (H2O)10 cluster. The cluster can be considered as derived from a cubic arrangement of eight water molecules with two outer edges. There are five independent water molecules. The hydrogen atoms of water molecules are located from the difference Fourier maps. However, only one appropriate hydrogen atom of O(8) is located, and no appropriate hydrogen atom of O(9) is obtained. For the five independent water molecules, four water molecules (O(5), O(6), O(8), O(9)) form a square. The O⋅⋅⋅O distances in the square are in the range of 2.751(7)-2.944(6) Å, similar to the reported cyclic water tetramer (the average O⋅⋅⋅O distance 2.834 Å) and the "opened-cube" water octamer (2.76-2.91 Å). The outer water molecule (O(7)) bridges the square water molecules and the COO group of the btec molecule via O-H⋅⋅⋅O hydrogen bonding interactions (O(7)⋅⋅⋅O(8) 2.714(6) Å; O(7)⋅⋅⋅O(1F) 2.838(4) Å). Two symmetry-related square water molecules are linked by two hydrogen bonding interactions O(5)⋅⋅⋅O(8G) and O(5G⋅⋅⋅O(9) (O⋅⋅⋅O distance 2.965(7) Å) and form the octamer water molecules. However, the oxygen atoms distances O(6)⋅⋅⋅O(9G) and O(9)⋅⋅⋅O(6G) along the opened edges are relatively long 3.454(6) Å, but shorter than 3.92 Å estimated in the "opened-cube" water octamer. The overall structure of the decamer water cluster can be described as an "opened-cube" with two outer edges. Such a structure of decamer water cluster, has not been experimentally observed so far, to the best of our knowledge. The reported structures of decamers are an adamantanoid "ice-like" cage, endohedral clusterization "molecule ice", a cyclic decamer with boat-chair-boat conformation, a discrete 2D sheetlike fragement, nonplanar eight-membered ring and two water molecules, infinite chains, two parallel cyclic pentamers with staggered conformation, decameric water ring, and a decameric water cluster containing a quasi-planar six-membered ring.

elements.content: A perspective view of the (H2O)10 cluster and its coordination environment in 1, showing two adjacent [Cd2(btec)] networks.
elements.clean_text: 2  A perspective view of the (H2O)10 cluster and its coordination environment in 1, showing two adjacent [Cd2(btec)] networks.

elements.content: 2 is a thick 2D framework. There are three independent Cd(II) atoms, one btb and two phth ligands (Figure ). Cd(1) and Cd(3) atoms are six-coordinated in a distorted octahedral geometry. Cd(1) is coordinated with two triazole nitrogen atoms from two btb ligands, four oxygen atoms from two COO groups of two phth ligands and two water ligands. Cd(3) is coordinated with six oxygen atoms from four water ligands and two COO groups of two phth. However, Cd(2) is coordinated with six oxygen atoms from three COO groups of three phth, and one triazole nitrogen atom from btb ligand in a distorted pentagonal-bipyramidal geometry. There are two different phth ligands. One phth bridges three Cd(II) atoms. Within this phth ligand one COO group (C(15)O(1)O(2)) acts as bidentate bridging Cd(1) and Cd(2) atoms with a Cd···Cd separation 6.4826(5) Å. The other COO group (C(16)O(3)O(4)) acts as bidentate chelating Cd(3) atom. The distance Cd(1)···Cd(3) through two COO groups of phth bridging is 5.5384(5) Å. Two COO groups (C(23)O(6)O(7) and C(24)O(8)O(9)) of the other phth ligand both act as bidentate chelating two Cd(2) atoms with a Cd···Cd separation of 6.5284(5) Å.
elements.clean_text: 2 is a thick 2D framework. There are three independent Cd(II) atoms, one btb and two phth ligands (Figure ). Cd(1) and Cd(3) atoms are six-coordinated in a distorted octahedral geometry. Cd(1) is coordinated with two triazole nitrogen atoms from two btb ligands, four oxygen atoms from two COO groups of two phth ligands and two water ligands. Cd(3) is coordinated with six oxygen atoms from four water ligands and two COO groups of two phth. However, Cd(2) is coordinated with six oxygen atoms from three COO groups of three phth, and one triazole nitrogen atom from btb ligand in a distorted pentagonal-bipyramidal geometry. There are two different phth ligands. One phth bridges three Cd(II) atoms. Within this phth ligand one COO group (C(15)O(1)O(2)) acts as bidentate bridging Cd(1) and Cd(2) atoms with a Cd⋅⋅⋅Cd separation 6.4826(5) Å. The other COO group (C(16)O(3)O(4)) acts as bidentate chelating Cd(3) atom. The distance Cd(1)⋅⋅⋅Cd(3) through two COO groups of phth bridging is 5.5384(5) Å. Two COO groups (C(23)O(6)O(7) and C(24)O(8)O(9)) of the other phth ligand both act as bidentate chelating two Cd(2) atoms with a Cd⋅⋅⋅Cd separation of 6.5284(5) Å.

elements.content: The coordination environment of Cd(II) atoms of 2.
elements.clean_text: 3  The coordination environment of Cd(II) atoms of 2.

elements.content: 2 forms a 2D network along the bc plane through the phth bridges (Figure and ). The btb ligand shows the gauche-antigauche conformation and bridges two Cd(II) atoms with a Cd(1)···Cd(2) distance of 11.3691(8) Å. 2 further constructs a thick 2D network along the a direction about 12.0 Å through the phth and btb bridges ( and ).
elements.clean_text: 2 forms a 2D network along the bc plane through the phth bridges (Figure  and ). The btb ligand shows the gauche-antigauche conformation and bridges two Cd(II) atoms with a Cd(1)⋅⋅⋅Cd(2) distance of 11.3691(8) Å. 2 further constructs a thick 2D network along the a direction about 12.0 Å through the phth and btb bridges ( and ).

elements.content: The 2D network constructed by phth ligands of 2.
elements.clean_text: 4  The 2D network constructed by phth ligands of 2.

elements.content: There are 4.5 independent lattice water molecules (The position occupancy factor of O(16) is 0.5). These lattice water molecules form the undulated water chains. The water chains are located in the gaps of the thick 2D networks (Figure ). These thick 2D networks act as a host to stabilize the water chains. There are hydrogen bonding interactions between the water chains and the coordinated waters or COO groups of 2D thick networks (). 2 forms a 3D hydrogen bonding network through these hydrogen bonding interactions (Figure ).
elements.clean_text: There are 4.5 independent lattice water molecules (The position occupancy factor of O(16) is 0.5). These lattice water molecules form the undulated water chains. The water chains are located in the gaps of the thick 2D networks (Figure ). These thick 2D networks act as a host to stabilize the water chains. There are hydrogen bonding interactions between the water chains and the coordinated waters or COO groups of 2D thick networks (). 2 forms a 3D hydrogen bonding network through these hydrogen bonding interactions (Figure ).

elements.clean_text: 5  A perspective view of the water chain in 2.

elements.content: The 3D hydrogen bonding network of 2, showing the water chain.
elements.clean_text: 6  The 3D hydrogen bonding network of 2, showing the water chain.

elements.content: The solid-state luminescence spectra of 1 and 2 reveal the emission maximum at 445 and 424 nm, respectively, upon excitation at 334 and 308 nm, respectively ( and ). These emissions can be attributed to the ligand-to-metal charge-transfer (LMCT). Thermogravimetric (TG) analysis shows that 1 first lost weight corresponding to 10 water molecules (observed 14.37%, calculated 14.61%) from 80 to 140 °C, leaving a framework of [Cd2(btec)(btb)3]. This framework was stable up to 260 °C (). 2 first lost weight corresponding to 7.5 water molecules (observed 15.15%, calculated 15.33%) from 80 to 180 °C, then continuously lost weight above about 190 °C.
elements.clean_text: The solid-state luminescence spectra of 1 and 2 reveal the emission maximum at 445 and 424 nm, respectively, upon excitation at 334 and 308 nm, respectively ( and ). These emissions can be attributed to the ligand-to-metal charge-transfer (LMCT). Thermogravimetric (TG) analysis shows that 1 first lost weight corresponding to 10 water molecules (observed 14.37%, calculated 14.61%) from 80 to 140 °C, leaving a framework of [Cd2(btec)(btb)3]. This framework was stable up to 260 °C (). 2 first lost weight corresponding to 7.5 water molecules (observed 15.15%, calculated 15.33%) from 80 to 180 °C, then continuously lost weight above about 190 °C.

elements.content: In summary, we have synthesized a novel 3D network 1 and a thick 2D network 2 using long flexible ligand btb and polycarboxylate ligand. 1 contains a discrete water decamer and 2 contains an undulated water chain. The btb ligands show completely anti (antianti-anti) and gauche-antigauche conformations in 1 and gauche-antianti conformation in 2, respectively. The polycarboxylate ligands can construct hydrophilic systems with a different gap. The gap of these hydrophilic systems can be filled by water molecules. The size of the water clusters can be controlled by adjusting the gap by the choice of the appropriate organic spacer and polycarboxylate.
elements.clean_text: In summary, we have synthesized a novel 3D network 1 and a thick 2D network 2 using long flexible ligand btb and polycarboxylate ligand. 1 contains a discrete water decamer and 2 contains an undulated water chain. The btb ligands show completely anti (antianti-anti) and gauche-antigauche conformations in 1 and gauche-antianti conformation in 2, respectively. The polycarboxylate ligands can construct hydrophilic systems with a different gap. The gap of these hydrophilic systems can be filled by water molecules. The size of the water clusters can be controlled by adjusting the gap by the choice of the appropriate organic spacer and polycarboxylate.

elements.content: Additional figures for crystal structures, the luminescence spectra, TG and IR. X-ray crystallographic file for 1 and 2 in CIF format (CCDC nos. 686078 and 686079). This material is available free of charge via Internet at http://pubs.acs.org.
elements.clean_text: Additional figures for crystal structures, the luminescence spectra, TG and IR. X-ray crystallographic file for 1 and 2 in CIF format (CCDC nos. 686078 and 686079). This material is available free of charge via Internet at http://pubs.acs.org.

elements.content:
The News Staff, Science 2004, 306, 2013.

Preparation of 1 and 2: A solution of H4btec (0.026 g, 0.1 mmol) in 10 mL of H2O was adjusted to approximately pH 6 with dilute Et3N solution. Then btb (0.058 g, 0.3 mmol) in 10 mL of CH3OH was added. This mixture was added to one side of the “H-shape” tube, and Cd(NO3)·3H2O (0.062 g, 0.2 mmol) in 20 mL of water was added to the other side of the “H-shape” tube. Colorless crystals of 1 were obtained in 65% yield (0.081 g) after one month. Anal. Calcd. For C34H58Cd2N18O18: C, 33.15; H, 4.75; N, 20.47. Found: C, 33.04; H, 4.68; N, 20.36 (%). 2 was prepared as for 1 by using H2phth instead of H4btec. The reaction reagents were H2phth (0.033 g, 0.2 mmol), btb (0.019 g, 0.1 mmol) and Cd(NO3)·3H2O (0.062 g, 0.2 mmol). Colorless crystals of 2 were obtained in 52% yield (0.046 g). Anal. Calcd. For C24H35Cd2N6O15.50: C, 32.74; H, 4.01; N 9.55. Found: C, 32.67; H, 3.94; N, 9.51 (%).

Found: C, 33.04; H, 4.68; N, 20.36 (%). 2 was prepared as for 1 by using H2phth instead of H4btec. The reaction reagents were H2phth (0.033 g, 0.2 mmol), btb (0.019 g, 0.1 mmol) and Cd(NO3)⋅3H2O (0.062 g, 0.2 mmol). Colorless crystals of 2 were obtained in 52% yield (0.046 g). Anal. Calcd. For C24H35Cd2N6O15.50: C, 32.74; H, 4.01; N 9.55. Found: C, 32.67; H, 3.94; N, 9.51 (%).

elements.content: Crystal data for 1: C34H58Cd2N18O18, M r = 1231.78, monoclinic, space group P21/c, a = 12.6665(16), b = 18.196(2), c = 10.9031(14) Å, β = 103.115(3)°, V = 2447.4(5) Å3, Z = 2, D c = 1.672 g cm−3, μ = 0.958 mm−1, 4455 [R(int) = 0.0503] unique reflections, 4028 data with I > 2σ(I), 353 parameters, R 1 = 0.0405, wR 2 = 0.0941, S = 1.089. 2: C24H35Cd2N6O15.50, M r = 880.38, monoclinic, space group P21/c, a = 14.5197(14), b = 11.0769(10), c = 21.106(2) Å, β = 107.720(2)°, V = 3233.5(6) Å3, Z = 4, D c = 1.808 g.cm−3, μ = 1.395 mm−1, 5891 [R(int) = 0.0254] unique reflections, 5682 data with I > 2σ(I), 500 parameters, R 1 = 0.0250, wR 2 = 0.0615, S = 1.072

cln_elements.content:
The solid-state luminescence spectra of 1 and 2 reveal the emission maximum at 445 and 424 nm, respectively, upon excitation at 334 and 308 nm, respectively ( and ). These emissions can be attributed to the ligand-to-metal charge-transfer (LMCT). Thermogravimetric (TG) analysis shows that 1 first lost weight corresponding to 10 water molecules (observed 14.37%, calculated 14.61%) from 80 to 140 °C, leaving a framework of [Cd2(btec)(btb)3]. This framework was stable up to 260 °C (). 2 first lost weight corresponding to 7.5 water molecules (observed 15.15%, calculated 15.33%) from 80 to 180 °C, then continuously lost weight above about 190 °C.

Crystal data for 1: C34H58Cd2N18O18, M r = 1231.78, monoclinic, space group P21/c, a = 12.6665(16), b = 18.196(2), c = 10.9031(14) Å, β = 103.115(3)°, V = 2447.4(5) Å3, Z = 2, D c = 1.672 g cm−3, μ = 0.958 mm−1, 4455 [R(int) = 0.0503] unique reflections, 4028 data with I > 2σ(I), 353 parameters, R 1 = 0.0405, wR 2 = 0.0941, S = 1.089. 2: C24H35Cd2N6O15.50, M r = 880.38, monoclinic, space group P21/c, a = 14.5197(14), b = 11.0769(10), c = 21.106(2) Å, β = 107.720(2)°, V = 3233.5(6) Å3, Z = 4, D c = 1.808 g.cm−3, μ = 1.395 mm−1, 5891 [R(int) = 0.0254] unique reflections, 5682 data with I > 2σ(I), 500 parameters, R 1 = 0.0250, wR 2 = 0.0615, S = 1.072
cln_elements.clean_text:
The solid-state luminescence spectra of 1 and 2 reveal the emission maximum at 445 and 424 nm, respectively, upon excitation at 334 and 308 nm, respectively ( and ). These emissions can be attributed to the ligand-to-metal charge-transfer (LMCT). Thermogravimetric (TG) analysis shows that 1 first lost weight corresponding to 10 water molecules (observed 14.37%, calculated 14.61%) from 80 to 140 °C, leaving a framework of [Cd2(btec)(btb)3]. This framework was stable up to 260 °C (). 2 first lost weight corresponding to 7.5 water molecules (observed 15.15%, calculated 15.33%) from 80 to 180 °C, then continuously lost weight above about 190 °C.

Crystal data for 1: C34H58Cd2N18O18, M r = 1231.78, monoclinic, space group P21/c, a = 12.6665(16), b = 18.196(2), c = 10.9031(14) Å, β = 103.115(3)°, V = 2447.4(5) Å3, Z = 2, D c = 1.672 g cm-3, μ = 0.958 mm-1, 4455 [R(int) = 0.0503] unique reflections, 4028 data with I > 2σ(I), 353 parameters, R 1 = 0.0405, wR 2 = 0.0941, S = 1.089. 2: C24H35Cd2N6O15.50, M r = 880.38, monoclinic, space group P21/c, a = 14.5197(14), b = 11.0769(10), c = 21.106(2) Å, β = 107.720(2)°, V = 3233.5(6) Å3, Z = 4, D c = 1.808 g.cm-3, μ = 1.395 mm-1, 5891 [R(int) = 0.0254] unique reflections, 5682 data with I > 2σ(I), 500 parameters, R 1 = 0.0250, wR 2 = 0.0615, S = 1.072

metadata.title: A New “Opened-Cube” (H2O)10 Cluster and Undulated Water Chain in Porous Metal−Organic Frameworks
